detailedSummary: The capstone project represents synthesis of advanced English studies through independent research. Students design, conduct, and present original research on a topic of their choice, demonstrating mastery of: research methods, critical analysis, scholarly writing, and contribution to academic conversation. The capstone process involves: selecting a focused research question, conducting comprehensive literature review, developing methodology, gathering and analyzing evidence, writing a substantial research paper (typically 25-40 pages), and presenting findings. Research may involve: textual analysis, archival research, theoretical application, comparative studies, or digital humanities methods. The project requires: independent work, time management, critical thinking, and ability to engage with complex scholarship. Students work with a faculty advisor who provides guidance and feedback. The capstone demonstrates: ability to conduct original research, contribute new insights, write at advanced level, and present work professionally. It may lead to: conference presentations, publication, or graduate study preparation. The capstone integrates: literary analysis, research skills, theoretical frameworks, and scholarly communication. It represents the culmination of English studies, showing readiness for graduate work, professional writing, or advanced literary analysis. Successful completion demonstrates: mastery of the discipline, ability to work independently, and contribution to knowledge in the field.
whyItMatters: The capstone project demonstrates mastery of English studies - completing independent research shows readiness for graduate work, professional writing, and contributing original knowledge to the field.

options: Mastery of research, analysis, and scholarly writing

options: Question development, research, analysis, writing, presentation
quizzes.explanation: The capstone involves the full research cycle: developing questions, conducting research, analyzing evidence, writing a substantial paper, and presenting findings.

quizzes.question: A capstone project requires:
quizzes.explanation: The capstone requires original research that contributes new insights or perspectives to the field, not just summarizing existing scholarship.

quizzes.question: Capstone projects are always exactly the same for all students.
quizzes.explanation: False. Capstone projects are individualized, allowing students to pursue research questions aligned with their interests and career goals.

quizzes.explanation: The capstone represents the culmination of English studies, demonstrating readiness for graduate work, professional writing, or advanced literary analysis.
